intro: Jussiaea myrtifolia subf. brevifolia, commonly known as the narrow-leaved jussiaea, is a flowering plant native to South America. It belongs to the family Onagraceae and is characterized by its small, lance-shaped leaves and clusters of pink to purple flowers. The plant typically grows in wetland or marshy habitats, preferring moist, nutrient-rich soils. It is often found in regions with temperate climates and is adapted to thrive in environments with high humidity. Due to its ornamental value, it is occasionally cultivated in gardens with suitable conditions.
